algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming on paths, simulating two robots moving simultaneously.
problem_summary_simple: Collect maximum cherries by going down-right then up-left, picking up cherries.
problem_summary_technical: DP state represents max cherries collected by two paths of same length ending at (i, k-i) and (j, k-j).
key_insights: The problem can be solved by simulating two robots moving simultaneously, one forward and one backward.
The DP state needs to track the positions of both robots at each step.
The constraint of same path length for both robots simplifies the DP state.
